quote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Poetry is language at its most distilled and most powerful.
author: Rita Dove

quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.
author: Plutarch

quote: The poet is a liar who always speaks the truth.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for the Creator, there is no poverty.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Every single soul is a poem.
author: Michael Franti

quote: Poetry is not only dream and vision; it is the skeleton architecture of our lives. It lays the foundations for a future of change, a bridge across our fears of what has never been before.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: If you cannot be a poet, be the poem.
author: David Carradine

quote: Poetry is an orphan of silence. The words never quite equal the experience behind them.
author: Charles Simic

quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: What is a poet? An unhappy person who conceals profound anguish in his heart but whose lips are so formed that as sighs and cries pass over them they sound like beautiful music.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Poetry is the revelation of a feeling that the poet believes to be interior and personal which the reader recognizes as his own.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: A poet is a nightingale, who sits in darkness and sings to cheer its own solitude with sweet sounds.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: To read a poem is to hear it with our eyes; to hear it is to see it with our ears.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
author: Socrates

quote: If my poetry aims to achieve anything, it's to deliver people from the limited ways in which they see and feel.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.
author: Novalis

quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Poetry is plucking at the heartstrings, and making music with them.
author: Dennis Gabor

quote: Poetry is ordinary language raised to the Nth power. Poetry is boned with ideas, nerved and blooded with emotions, all held together by the delicate, tough skin of words.
author: Paul Engle

quote: When power leads man toward arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The crown of literature is poetry.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Poetry is the art of creating imaginary gardens with real toads.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: How do poems grow? They grow out of your life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: You will find poetry nowhere unless you bring some of it with you.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Poetry is thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: I consider myself a poet first and a musician second. I live like a poet and I'll die like a poet.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Poetry is all that is worth remembering in life.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Breathe-in experience, breathe-out poetry.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: In science one tries to tell people, in such a way as to be understood by everyone, something that no one ever knew before. But in poetry, it's the exact opposite.
author: Paul Dirac

quote: When it comes to atoms, language can be used only as in poetry. The poet, too, is not nearly so concerned with describing facts as with creating images.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: You don't have to suffer to be a poet; adolescence is enough suffering for anyone.
author: John Ciardi

quote: God is the perfect poet.
author: Robert Browning

quote: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: A poet's work is to name the unnameable, to point at frauds, to take sides, start arguments, shape the world, and stop it going to sleep.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: Poetry is the mother-tongue of the human race.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: We all write poems; it is simply that poets are the ones who write in words.
author: John Fowles

quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.
author: Voltaire

quote: Poetry is nearer to vital truth than history.
author: Plato

quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history; for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who draws noble delights from sentiments of poetry is a true poet, though he has never written a line in all his life.
author: George Sand

quote: I have nothing to say, I am saying it, and that is poetry.
author: John Cage

quote: Poetry is that art which selects and arranges the symbols of thought in such a manner as to excite the imagination the most powerfully and delightfully.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: To see clearly is poetry, prophecy and religion all in one.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A poem is true if it hangs together. Information points to something else. A poem points to nothing but itself.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: 'Therefore' is a word the poet must not know.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Poetry, even when apparently most fantastic, is always a revolt against artifice, a revolt, in a sense, against actuality.
author: James Joyce
